summary: This bill, the Natural Gas Tax Repeal Act, seeks to amend the Clean Air Act. Specifically, it repeals Section 136 of the Act, which concerns methane emissions and waste reduction programs for petroleum and natural gas systems.  Furthermore, the bill includes a rescission of any unobligated funds related to the repealed section. The bill was introduced in the Senate on January 16, 2025, by Senator Cruz and several cosponsors.
